contents:
This talk looked at Liberty Mutual’s transformation to Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and DevOps. For a large, heavily regulated industry, this task can not only be daunting, but viewed by many as impossible. Often, organizations try to reduce the friction through micro-fixes, but Eddie’s team asked how to change the culture to reduce the friction and concluded with the following final points:
 Don’t mandate DevOps. Give employees the chance to master their discipline with examples to set and follow. Favor deep end-to-end accomplishments over broad but incremental steps forward. Focus on taking the right teams far before encouraging broad adoption. Centralize the platforms and tools that your teams shouldn’t be thinking about. Provide foundational services/commodities and let teams stay on purpose. Incorporate contributions from everyone; don’t stifle autonomy. Stay open to new ways of working. Challenge security policies, but respect intentions. Find new ways to enforce concerns without abandoning precaution.
title: Organically DevOps: Building Quality and Security into the Software Supply Chain at Liberty Mutual

contents:
Customer Insight Customer insight was a multi language application for Telecom Industry to monitor their network user’s experience and improve customer support. The application was meant to collect user’s network performance parameters to build coverage maps and find weak areas. The application also enabled the user to run call sms and internet speed tests for runtime diagnostics.
Application Screens The application UI was based on a View Pager an the user could swipe through the dashboard and test screens.
Dashboard The first screen of the application that gives the user all the basic information about the user’s network like carries’s name, technology and signal strength
Call Test The application was capable of a short call test that is usually performed in network quality surveys where a call to a number is made multiple times and the line is kept connected for 30 seconds. During this time the network quality parameters are monitored and can give the Network services providers information about the network quality.
SMS Test The SMS test works the same way the call test did. A few SMSs were generated from the phone to the same number and from sending to the tien of delivery the network quality was measured.
Internet Test The Internet test tested the ping, upload and the download speed for the conntected Wifi or data conntection
title: Customer Insight
